group.name: Carbonyl group. Low specificity
group.hint: Hits carboxylic acid, ester, ketone, aldehyde, carbonic acid/ester,anhydride, carbamic acid/ester, acyl halide, amide.

group.name: Carbonyl group
group.hint: Hits either resonance structure

group.name: Carbonyl with Carbon
group.hint: Hits aldehyde, ketone, carboxylic acid (except formic), anhydride (except formic), acyl halides (acid halides). Won't hit carbamic acid/ester, carbonic acid/ester.

group.name: Carbonyl with Nitrogen.
group.hint: Hits amide, carbamic acid/ester, poly peptide

group.name: Carbonyl with Oxygen.
group.hint: Hits ester, carboxylic acid, carbonic acid or ester, carbamic acid or ester, anhydride Won't hit aldehyde or ketone.

group.name: Acyl Halide
group.hint: acid halide, -oyl halide

group.name: Carbamate.
group.hint: Hits carbamic esters, acids, and zwitterions

group.name: Carbamic acid.
group.hint: Hits carbamic acids and zwitterions.

group.name: Carboxylate Ion.
group.hint: Hits conjugate bases of carboxylic, carbamic, and carbonic acids.

group.name: Carbonic Acid or Carbonic Ester
group.hint: Carbonic Acid, Carbonic Ester, or combination

group.name: Carbonic Acid or Carbonic Acid-Ester
group.hint: Hits acid and conjugate base. Won't hit carbonic acid diester

group.name: Carbonic Ester (carbonic acid diester)
group.hint: Won't hit carbonic acid or combination carbonic acid/ester

group.name: Carboxylic acid
group.hint: -oic acid, COOH

group.name: Ester Also hits anhydrides
group.hint: won't hit formic anhydride.

group.name: Primary or secondary amine, not amide.
group.hint: Not ammonium ion (N must be 3-connected), not ammonia (H count can't be 3). Primary or secondary is specified by N's H-count (H2 and H1 respectively). Will hit cyanamides and thioamides

group.name: Primary amine, not amide
group.hint: Not amide (C not double bonded to a hetero-atom), not ammonium ion (N must be 3-connected), not ammonia (N's H-count can't be 3), not cyanamide (C not triple bonded to a hetero-atom)

group.name: Two primary or secondary amines
group.hint: Here we use the disconnection symbol ('.') to match two separate unbonded identical patterns.

group.name: Generic amino acid: low specificity
group.hint: For use w/ non-standard a.a. search. hits pro but not gly. Hits acids and conjugate bases. Hits single a.a.s and specific residues w/in polypeptides (internal, or terminal)

group.name: Dipeptide group. generic amino acid: low specificity.
group.hint: Won't hit pro or gly. Hits acids and conjugate bases.

group.name: Amino Acid
group.hint: Replace * w/ a specific a.a. side chain from the 18_standard_side_chains list to hit a specific standard a.a. Won't work with Proline or Glycine, they have their own SMARTS (see side chain list). Hits acids and conjugate bases. Hits single a.a.s and specific residues w/i n polypeptides (internal, or terminal). {e.g. usage: Alanine side chain is [CH3X4] . Search is [$([NX3H2,NX4H3+]),$([NX3H](C)(C))][CX4H]([ CH3X4])[CX3](=[OX1])[OX2H,OX1-,N]}

group.name: Arginine side chain.
group.hint: Hits acid and conjugate base.

group.name: Aspargine side chain.
group.hint: Also hits Gln side chain when used alone.

group.name: Aspartate (or Aspartic acid) side chain.
group.hint: Hits acid and conjugate base. Also hits Glu side chain when used alone.

group.name: Cysteine side chain.
group.hint: Hits acid and conjugate base

group.name: Glutamate (or Glutamic acid) side chain.
group.hint: Hits acid and conjugate base.

group.name: Azide group.
group.hint: Hits any atom with an attached azide.

group.name: Azide ion.
group.hint: Hits N in azide ion

group.name: ANitrogen.
group.hint: Nitrogen in N-containing compound. aromatic or aliphatic. Most general interpretation of 'azo'

group.name: Azo Nitrogen. Low specificity.
group.hint: Hits diazene, azoxy and some diazo structures

group.name: Azo Nitrogen.diazene
group.hint: (diaza alkene)

group.name: Azole.
group.hint: 5 member aromatic heterocycle w/ 2double bonds. contains N and another non C (N,O,S) subclasses are furo-, thio-, pyrro- (replace CH o' furfuran, thiophene, pyrrol w/ N)

group.name: Substituted imine
group.hint: Schiff base

group.name: Nitrate group
group.hint: Also hits nitrate anion

group.name: Nitro group
group.hint: Hits both forms.

group.name: N-Oxide
group.hint: Hits both forms. Won't hit azoxy, nitro, nitroso,or nitrate.

group.name: Hydroxyl_acidic
group.hint: An acidic hydroxyl is a hydroxyl bonded to an atom which is multiply bonded to a hetero atom, this includes carboxylic, sulphur, phosphorous, halogen and nitrogen oxyacids.

group.name: Peroxide groups.
group.hint: Also hits anions.

group.name: Phosphoric_acid groups.
group.hint: Hits both depiction forms. Hits orthophosphoric acid and polyphosphoric acid anhydrides. Doesn't hit monophosphoric acid anhydride esters (including acidic mono- and di- esters) but will hit some polyphosphoric acid anhydride esters (mono- esters on pyrophosphoric acid and longer, di- esters on linear triphosphoric acid and longer).

group.name: Phosphoric_ester groups.
group.hint: Hits both depiction forms. Doesn't hit non-ester phosphoric_acid groups.

group.family: thio groups ( thio-, thi-, sulpho-, mercapto- )
group.name: Carbo-Thiocarboxylate

group.family: thio groups ( thio-, thi-, sulpho-, mercapto- )
group.name: Carbo-Thioester

group.family: thio groups ( thio-, thi-, sulpho-, mercapto- )
group.name: Thio analog of carbonyl
group.hint: Where S replaces O. Not a thioamide.

group.family: thio groups ( thio-, thi-, sulpho-, mercapto- )
group.name: Thiol, Sulfide or Disulfide Sulfur

group.family: thio groups ( thio-, thi-, sulpho-, mercapto- )
group.name: Thiol

group.family: thio groups ( thio-, thi-, sulpho-, mercapto- )
group.name: Sulfur with at-least one hydrogen.

group.family: thio groups ( thio-, thi-, sulpho-, mercapto- )
group.name: Thioamide
Sulfide
group.hint: -alkylthio Won't hit thiols. Hits disulfides.

group.name: Mono-sulfide
group.hint: alkylthio- or alkoxy- Won't hit thiols. Won't hit disulfides.

group.name: Di-sulfide
group.hint: Won't hit thiols. Won't hit mono-sulfides.

group.name: Two Sulfides
group.hint: Won't hit thiols. Won't hit mono-sulfides. Won't hit disulfides.

group.name: Sulfinate
group.hint: Won't hit Sulfinic Acid. Hits Both Depiction Forms.

group.name: Sulfinic Acid
group.hint: Won't hit substituted Sulfinates. Hits Both Depiction Forms. Hits acid and conjugate base (sulfinate).

group.name: Sulfone. Low specificity.
group.hint: Hits all sulfones, including heteroatom-substituted sulfones: sulfonic acid, sulfonate, sulfuric acid mono- and di- esters, sulfamic acid, sulfamate, sulfonamide... Hits Both Depiction Forms.

group.name: Sulfone. High specificity.
group.hint: Only hits carbo- sulfones (Won't hit herteroatom-substituted molecules). Hits Both Depiction Forms.

group.name: Sulfonic acid. High specificity.
group.hint: Only hits carbo- sulfonic acids (Won't hit herteroatom-substituted molecules). Hits acid and conjugate base. Hits Both Depiction Forms. Hits Arene sulfonic acids.

group.name: Sulfonate
group.hint: (sulfonic ester) Only hits carbon-substituted sulfur (Oxygen may be herteroatom-substituted). Hits Both Depiction Forms.

group.name: Sulfonamide.
group.hint: Only hits carbo- sulfonamide. Hits Both Depiction Forms.

group.name: Carbo-azosulfone
group.hint: Partial N-Analog of Sulfone

group.name: Sulfonamide
group.hint: (sulf drugs) Won't hit sulfamic acid or sulfamate. Hits Both Depiction Forms.

group.name: Sulfoxide Low specificity.
group.hint: ( sulfinyl, thionyl ) Analog of carbonyl where S replaces C. Hits all sulfoxides, including heteroatom-substituted sulfoxides, dialkylsulfoxides carbo-sulfoxides, sulfinate, sulfinic acids... Hits Both Depiction Forms. Won't hit sulfones.

group.name: Sulfoxide High specificity
group.hint: (sulfinyl , thionyl) Analog of carbonyl where S replaces C. Only hits carbo-sulfoxides (Won't hit herteroatom-substituted molecules). Hits Both Depiction Forms. Won't hit sulfones.

group.name: Sulfate
group.hint: (sulfuric acid monoester) Only hits when oxygen is carbon-substituted. Hits acid and conjugate base. Hits Both Depiction Forms.

group.name: Sulfuric acid ester (sulfate ester) Low specificity.
group.hint: Hits sulfuric acid, sulfuric acid monoesters (sulfuric acids) and diesters (sulfates). Hits acid and conjugate base. Hits Both Depiction Forms.

group.name: Sulfuric Acid Diester.
group.hint: Only hits when oxygen is carbon-substituted. Hits Both Depiction Forms

group.name: Sulfamate.
group.hint: Only hits when oxygen is carbon-substituted. Hits Both Depiction Forms.

group.name: Sulfamic Acid.
group.hint: Hits acid and conjugate base. Hits Both Depiction Forms.

group.name: Sulfenic acid.
group.hint: Hits acid and conjugate base.

group.name: Any carbon attached to any halogen
Three_halides groups
group.hint: Hits SMILES that have three halides.

group.name: Acid
group.hint: Proton donor

group.name: Carboxylic acid
group.hint: (-oic acid, COOH)

group.name: Hydroxyl_acidic
group.hint: An acidic hydroxyl is a hydroxyl bonded to an atom which is multiply bonded to a hetero atom, this includes carboxylic, sulphur, pho sphorous, halogen and nitrogen oxyacids

group.name: Phosphoric_Acid
group.hint: Hits both forms. Hits orthophosphoric acid and polyphosphoric acid anhydrides. Doesn't hit monophosphoric acid anhydride esters (in cluding acidic mono- and di- esters) but will hit some polyphosphoric acid anhydride esters (mono- esters on pyrophosphoric acid and longe r, di- esters on linear triphosphoric acid and longer). Hits acid and conjugate base.

group.name: Sulfonic Acid. High specificity.
group.hint: Only hits carbo- sulfonic acids (Won't hit herteroatom-substituted molecules). Hits acid and conjugate base. Hits Both Depiction Fo rms. Hits Arene sulfonic acids.
